author: @OldManGeek88
title: Cobra Kai Co-Creator Schlossberg Confirms Longer Series Finale & More
text: Posted in: [Netflix](/tv/netflix/), [Preview](/tv/preview-tv/), [streaming](/tv/streaming/), [TV](/tv/) | Tagged: [cobra kai](/tag/cobra-kai/), [netflix](/tag/netflix/), [preview](/tag/preview-2/), [Season 6](/tag/season-6/) Cobra Kai Co-Creator Schlossberg Confirms Longer Series Finale & More Cobra Kai co-creator Hayden Schlossberg answered fans' questions about the sixth & final season on social media - here are the highlights. Article Summary - Cobra Kai S6 eyed for 2024 release, may have lengthier finale. - Schlossberg teases Terry Silver's students might join Miyagi-Fang. - Eager fans can expect a new dojo name reveal in Season 6 opener. - Promised 'biggest, baddest' season. Creators highlight show's end. When we last checked in on how things were looking with the sixth & final season of Josh Heald, Jon Hurwitz, and Hayden Schlossberg's Ralph Macchio & William Zabka-starring Cobra Kai, Hurwitz [offered an update](https://bleedingcool.com/tv/cobra-kai-creators-season-6-filming-update-decision-to-end-series/) on filming (expected to begin shortly after the start of the new year) while Heald explained how they knew now was the right time to bring the series to an end. First this go-around, we're taking a look at the spoiler-free answers that Schlossberg offered on Twitter/X regarding the "Karate Kid" spinoff's final run. Here's a look at the highlights: First up, Schlossberg says the goal is to film in 2024 and have the 10-episode final season hit screens by the end of the year and that they're eyeing a longer series finale episode (with the season also having a longer overall runtime). There's a "good chance" that the remaining students from Terry Silver's (Thomas Ian Griffith) Cobra Kai will join Miyagi-Fang. The Sekai Taikai will require a team leader from each dojo, and we will learn the name of the new dojo during the Season 6 opener. As for the questions regarding who would get the most focus during the final seasons, Schlossberg drove home the point that "everyone gets their moment in the spotlight" and that we "will learn more about everyone's past, present, and future." Cobra Kai Creators Address Season 6 & Franchise's Future Promising the "biggest" and "baddest" season yet, the show's creators penned a letter to the show's supporters thanking them for their support and explaining the importance of ending Cobra Kai "on our terms" when the news was first announced earlier this year. Here's a look back at their letter: Ralph Macchio (Daniel LaRusso), William Zabka (Johnny Lawrence), Courtney Henggeler (Amanda LaRusso), Xolo Maridueña (Miguel Diaz), Tanner Buchanan (Robby Keene), Mary Mouser (Samantha LaRusso), Jacob Bertrand (Hawk), Gianni Decenzo (Demetri), Vanessa Rubio (Carmen), Peyton List (Tory), and Martin Kove (John Kreese) star, along with Dallas Dupree Young (Kenny), Oona O'Brien (Devon) and Thomas Ian Griffith (Terry Silver). Alicia Hannah-Kim (Minx) portrays South Korean sensei Kim Da-Eun, who plays a major role in Terry Silver's expansion plans. Dallas Dupree Young's Kenny Payne had been promoted to series regular for the fifth season. In addition, Sean Kanan is returned to the franchise to reprise his role as Mike Barnes. Cobra Kai is written and executive produced by series creators Josh Heald, Jon Hurwitz, and Hayden Schlossberg via production company Counterbalance Entertainment. Will Smith, James Lassiter, and Caleeb Pinkett executive produce for Westbrook Entertainment along with Susan Ekins in association with Sony Pictures Television. Macchio and Zabka also serve as executive [producers.](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWOA1ZGywLbqmigxE4Qlvuw) [ Stay up-to-date and support the site by following Bleeding Cool on Google News today! ](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMPHflgsw1IauAw?hl=en-US&gl=US&ceid=US:en)

author: Y.L.
title: VRAI OU FAUX. JO de Paris 2024 : "C’est une blague..?" Des fleurs en plastique ont-elles été accrochées dans les arbres de Marseille ? - ladepeche.fr
text:
Marseille est en effervescence. La ville va connaître une semaine chargée en émotion avec notamment la demi-finale retour d’Europa League de l’OM contre l’Atalanta Bergame après son match nul obtenu au Vélodrome . Mais surtout, car la flamme olympique arrive en France via la cité phocéenne ce mercredi 8 mai.
A lire aussi : JO de Paris 2024 : "Le cœur de la torche saluera la contribution de chacun des porteurs de flamme"… Ce cadeau inédit que recevront les Éclaireurs
Alors que la crise des éboueurs continue et s’aggrave dans la ville , certains internautes ont remarqué que des fleurs étaient apparues comme par magie ces derniers jours. "Par pitié, ils font exprès de mettre des fleurs en plastique au bord de l’eau ? " s’est notamment indigné Eric Akopian, le fondateur de l’association Clean My Calanques dans une vidéo postée sur Instagram ce dimanche 5 mai.
Des fleurs en plastique oui, pour les JO, non "Ils ont pas fait ça pour l’arrivée de la flamme", s’interroge l’homme, qui a ramassé ces fausses fleurs de cerisier dans le 2e arrondissent de Marseille. Après cette vidéo, certains ironisaient : "la prochaine fois, (mettez des) arbres en plastique direct, c’est plus pratique" ou encore "c’est une blague ?", pouvait-on lire sous la vidéo, supprimée depuis.
A lire aussi : JO de Paris 2024 : pourquoi la flamme olympique ne s’éteint jamais (et qu’est-ce qu’on fait si ça arrive)
Dans la réalité, les fausses fleurs ne sont pas là pour les JO de Paris 2024 et l’arrivée de la flamme olympique prévue ce mercredi 8 mai 2024. Il s’agit d’une initiative de l’association des commerçants des Voûtes de la Major, "afin de rendre les magasins, les cafés et les restaurants plus attractifs de mai à septembre", assure Sandra Chalinet, coordinatrice chez Oiko, la société en charge de la gestion du centre commercial, citée par France 3 .
A lire aussi : VIDEO. JO de Paris 2024 : "Un jour, si les Jeux sont un peu plus responsables…" Pourquoi une association refuse de porter la flamme olympique
"Les poissons vont s’étouffer" La ville de Marseille a délivré les autorisations pour installer ces fleurs en plastique… Qui ne le sont pas vraiment. Elles sont en rayonne, une fibre textile tirée de la viscose, assure Sandra Chalinet. "Ce matériau est produit sans perçage ou détérioration, et l’ensemble est recyclé à la fin de l’été", poursuit-elle. Mais pour Eric Akopian, elles ont un impact sur l’environnement, "même si ce matériau est sans doute au plastique, la fabrication de la rayonne implique un procédé chimique polluant".
A lire aussi : Le Flav Lab, le laboratoire spécialisé dans les arômes, se met au parfum des JO Paris 2024
Il s’est indigné en questionnant : "les poissons qui vont s’étouffer en mangeant les fleurs, vous pensez qu’ils vont nous remercier d’avoir mis de la rayonne plutôt que du plastique ?" Probablement pas, mais ce n’est pas la faute des Jeux Olympiques cette fois-ci.

author: Timothy McGill
title: US Weather this Weekend: Arctic air moves out and the West Coast is slammed with heavy rain and high-elevation snow
text:
US Weather this Weekend: Arctic air moves out and the West Coast is slammed with heavy rain and high-elevation snow
The lake-effect snow machine takes a break this weekend, but snow will fly in the mountains in the western U.S. A warm-up this weekend for most of the country as 60s nudge northward into the central plains.
People who live in the lake-effect snow belt of the Great Lakes and Ohio Valley will give their shovels a rest this weekend. The Arctic air that has fueled heavy snowfall, measured in feet in spots, is retreating northward.
Single-digit lows Saturday morning across northern [Minnesota](https://www.theweather.com/minnesota.htm), [Wisconsin](https://www.theweather.com/wisconsin.htm), the Upper Peninsula of [Michigan](https://www.theweather.com/michigan.htm), and [Maine](https://www.theweather.com/maine.htm) will be the last vestiges of the bitter cold air.
A significant warm-up on the way for most of the country
Temperatures on Saturday afternoon will be between at least five to 15 degrees above average, along and east of the Rockies to the Ohio Valley region. It will be even warmer on Sunday, with highs in the central U.S. running around 10 to almost 25 degrees above average.
The rest of the country from New England southward along the Appalachians into northern [Georgia](https://www.theweather.com/georgia-cc60.htm) and along the West Coast will be near our just below average on Sunday.
The storm train continues in the Pacific Northwest as more mountain snow falls
A late-week Pacific cyclone will continue on its eastward track Saturday, spreading moderate to heavy rain inland from Washington southward into central California. As the moisture-laden air rises over the Sierra Nevada, Cascade, and Olympic Mountain ranges, it will squeeze out areas of heavy snow.
The Weather Prediction Center has outlined a portion of northern California for a marginal risk, level one out of four, for heavy rainfall that could cause flash flooding on Saturday.
This system moves into the northern and central Rockies and squeezes out more snow for these regions on Sunday. Models are suggesting up to at least a foot of snow for portions of Idaho and Wyoming, with northern Utah seeing several inches, too.
A storm in the central U.S. will produce mostly rain as it moves eastward
The residual moisture and energy from a Pacific system that moved onshore late this week will sweep eastward out of the Rockies and into the central plains and fuel a low-pressure system. The storm will deepen over eastern Kansas on Saturday and then push northeastward into the upper Midwest by Sunday.
A return flow of moisture from the Gulf Coast ahead of the system's advancing cold front will fuel thunderstorms that could produce heavy rain in portions of the central Plains on Saturday.
The Ohio Valley and Tennessee Valley regions could get a decent soaking on Sunday. Even on the usually colder backside of this system, little to no snow will fall because of the weekend's moderating temperatures.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: EMSA paramedic explains importance of dressing for cold weather
text: Okla. — FOX23 spoke with an EMSA paramedic about the importance of dressing for the cold weather and being prepared. As of midnight on Jan. 12, EMSA has responded to four cold related calls and transported two patients to the hospital. Preparing to be outdoors is key, according to EMSA Paramedic Shawn Burch who has spent more than two decades on the job. He’s also a clinical services manager and offered advice. “Whether you’re taking a ten-minute drive across town or walking to your mailbox, be dressed for the weather," he said. "Bad things happen when you don’t expect them to happen.” With temperatures dropping down into the single digits this weekend, he says it’s all about dressing in layers. In addition to putting on the heavy coat, it’s also important to wear the hat and gloves, and hand warmers can also be helpful. “Stocking caps are great, a lot of people like to wear just like the little earmuffs, I would probably go as far with this weather with the stocking cap that covers your ears as well,” he said. Burch says signs of hypothermia include when you stop shivering, things like slurred speech, confusion, and maybe some lethargy or difficulty walking. It can eventually lead to being unconscious. According to the CDC, signs and symptoms of frostbite include: Other signs include: As far as when you need to go to the emergency room, if the numbness isn’t going away and the discoloration isn’t going away, Burch said it’s probably a good time to go in and get it evaluated. Burch said if you're driving, pack essentials like jumper cables, blankets, snacks, and water. Don't forget to charge your electronics which lose power quickly in the cold. Bringing a charged battery pack for your phone is also a good idea.
